column4: hey, C programming question. Say we have int a = 4; int b = 34; Is there any way to make printf("%d\n%d\n", a, b); print 04 for a? assume we don't know what a's value is
Yes.  You can specify a width for the field, and also specify it be zero padded instead of space padded.
I did %2d, but it only printed a space. What's the syntax?
%02d, but again, this is offtopic for here. ##C or #ubuntu-offtopic would be better places for these questions
